qas.question: Who's liberal political ideas influenced the Whigs?
Name the two people who's concepts of universal rights influenced the Whigs.
Did the Whigs want to limit the monarch's power?

answers.text: championing constitutional monarchy with strict limits on the monarch's power

qas.question: Did the Whigs support or oppose the Catholic king?

answers.text: the Whigs adamantly opposed a Catholic king as a threat to liberty

qas.question: What was Algernon Sidney considered a threat to?
Who did Algernon Sidney want to be tolerant towards?
Who's concepts of universal rights influenced wealthy merchants?
What did wealthy merchants want to put strict limits on?
What kind of political ideas did a Catholic king support?

context: As the century wore on, the factions slowly began to adopt more coherent political tendencies as the interests of their power bases began to diverge. The Whig party's initial base of support from the great aristocratic families, widened to include the emerging industrial interests and wealthy merchants. As well as <a2_0>championing constitutional monarchy with strict limits on <b7_0>the monarch's power<b7_0/><a2_0/>, <a3_0>the Whigs adamantly opposed a Catholic king as a threat to <b4_0>liberty<b4_0/><a3_0/>, and believed in extending toleration to <b5_0>nonconformist Protestants<b5_0/>, or dissenters. A major influence on the Whigs were the <b8_0>liberal<b8_0/> political ideas of <a0_0>John Locke<a0_0/>, and the concepts of universal rights employed by <a1_0><b6_0>Locke and Algernon Sidney<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
